verses.verse: Then Bildad <WH1085> the Shuhite <WH7747> answered, <WH6030>
"How <WH575> long <WH5704> will you speak <WH4448> these things? <WH561> Shall the words of your mouth <WH6310> be a mighty <WH3524> wind? <WH7307>
Does God <WH410> pervert <WH5791> justice? <WH4941> Or does the Almighty <WH7706> pervert <WH5791> righteousness? <WH6664>
If your children <WH1121> have sinned <WH2398> against him, <WH7971> He has delivered them into the hand of <WH3027> their disobedience. <WH6588>
If you want to seek <WH7836> God <WH410> diligently, <WH7836> make your supplication <WH2603> to the Almighty. <WH7706>
If you were pure <WH2134> and upright, <WH3477> surely now he would awaken <WH5782> for you, <WH5116> and make the habitation of your righteousness <WH6664> prosperous. <WH7999>
Though your beginning <WH7225> was small, <WH4705> yet your latter end <WH319> would greatly <WH3966> increase. <WH7685>
"Please inquire <WH7592> of past <WH7223> generations. <WH1755> Find <WH3559> out about the learning <WH2714> of their fathers. <WH1>
(For we are but of yesterday, <WH8543> and know <WH3045> nothing, <WH3117> because our days on earth <WH776> are a shadow. <WH6738>)
Shall they not teach <WH3384> you, <WH559> tell you, <WH3318> and utter words <WH4405> out of their heart? <WH3820>
"Can the papyrus <WH1573> grow up <WH1342> without mire? <WH1207> Can <WH7685> the rushes <WH260> grow <WH7685> without <WH1097> water? <WH4325>
While it is yet in its greenness, <WH3> not cut down, <WH6998> it withers <WH3001> before <WH6440> any other reed. <WH2682>
So are the paths <WH734> of all who forget <WH7911> God. <WH410> The hope <WH8615> of the godless <WH2611> man shall perish, <WH6>
Whose confidence <WH3689> shall break apart, <WH6990> Whose trust <WH4009> is a spider <WH5908>'s web. <WH1004>
He shall lean <WH8172> on his house, <WH1004> but it shall not stand. <WH5975> He shall cling <WH2388> to it, <WH6965> but it shall not endure.
He is green <WH7373> before <WH6440> the sun. <WH8121> His shoots <WH3127> go forth <WH3318> over his garden. <WH1593>
His roots <WH8328> are wrapped around <WH5440> the rock pile. <WH1530> He sees <WH2372> the place <WH1004> of stones. <WH68>
If he is destroyed <WH1104> from his place, <WH4725> then it shall deny <WH3584> him, <WH7200> saying, 'I have not seen you.'
Behold, <WH4885> this is the joy of his way: <WH1870> out of the earth, <WH6083> others <WH312> shall spring. <WH6779>
"Behold, <WH410> God will not cast away <WH3988> a blameless <WH8535> man, <WH2388> neither will he uphold the evildoers. <WH7489>
He will still fill <WH4390> your mouth <WH6310> with laughter, <WH7814> your lips <WH8193> with shouting. <WH8643>
Those who hate <WH8130> you shall be clothed <WH3847> with shame. <WH1322> The tent <WH168> of the wicked <WH7563> shall be no more. <WH369>"
